content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a Julia function to clean a column name:

```julia
function clean_column(col::AbstractString)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s|-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function takes a string `col` as input, converts it into lower case, removes any leading or trailing white spaces using the `strip()` function and replaces all occurrences of space and hyphen with an underscore. It returns the cleaned column name as per the requirement. 

Example:
```julia
print(clean_column("My Column")) # Outputs "my_column"
```
